intro: Cinchona succirubra, commonly known as the red cinchona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It is closely related to other cinchona species used in the production of quinine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
